item.title: Rubio Says U.S. to ‘Move On’ From Ukraine Peace Efforts if No Progress Soon
item.description: “If it is not possible to end the war in Ukraine, we need to move on,” Secretary of State Marco Rubio said as he departed meetings in Paris.

item.title: G.O.P. Lawmakers Visit Syria to Assess Situation Under New Government
item.description: The two Republican congressmen were expected to meet with the country’s new leadership and visit areas destroyed during the long civil war.

item.title: ‘Psychological Torture’: London Bans Busking in a Famed Tourist Hub
item.description: Noise complaints led the authorities to halt street performances in Leicester Square. Some miss the music. Others found the noise “bloody annoying.”

item.title: Syrians Recount Gas Attack: Choking, Shaking, Foaming at the Mouth
item.description: Syria’s ousted dictator, Bashar al-Assad, unleashed a Sarin gas strike on the suburbs of Damascus in 2013, killing at least 1,500. Now, the survivors ...

item.title: Cambodia and China Strengthen Ties as US Imposes Tariffs
item.description: China is the biggest foreign patron of Cambodia, where Mr. Xi concluded a tour of Southeast Asia. But the region also needs to curry favor with Presid...
